DataElement.preferredName: Cancer Outcome Burden on Employment Medical Expenditure Panel Survey Assessment Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas._The result of an action._The quantity of something that is borne or carried by an individual or population._The state of being engaged in an activity or service for wages or salary._A survey about the lasting effects of cancer and cancer treatments on the lives of those who have been diagnosed with cancer. It asks about the effects of cancer, its treatment, or the lasting effects of that treatment on employment, finances, health insurance coverage, and life in general._a free text field to specify information on the evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease

The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas._The result of an action._The quantity of something that is borne or carried by an individual or population._The state of being engaged in an activity or service for wages or salary._A survey about the lasting effects of cancer and cancer treatments on the lives of those who have been diagnosed with cancer. It asks about the effects of cancer, its treatment, or the lasting effects of that treatment on employment, finances, health insurance coverage, and life in general.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

It asks about the effects of cancer, its treatment, or the lasting effects of that treatment on employment, finances, health insurance coverage, and life in general.

Concepts.definition: The quantity of something that is borne or carried by an individual or population.
The state of being engaged in an activity or service for wages or salary.

A survey about the lasting effects of cancer and cancer treatments on the lives of those who have been diagnosed with cancer. It asks about the effects of cancer, its treatment, or the lasting effects of that treatment on employment, finances, health insurance coverage, and life in general.
